sec.div: (c) Intra-individual variation in winter metabolic performance
sec.p: Studies on seasonal variation of avian metabolic performance are typically conducted at the population level [ 11, 18, 30, 51] and, although it is rarely stated, they generally assume that population patterns are reflective of those observable within individuals. As far as we know, this is the first study to document with an extensive dataset seasonal variation of metabolism at both the population and individual levels in a resident bird species. Our findings support the common assumption; patterns observed at the population level reflected intra-individual variation in body mass, mass-independent BMR, M SUM and ME ( Figure 3Aâ€“C) and are therefore representative of average individual phenotypic flexibility.
